I paid $37.92 for a 7Gig server that constantly crashed or lagged.  When I reached out to support, I was told to download Spark (which I did).  The first support staff member was able to help us, getting us from 300+ ticks  behind to about 30.  After another day we were back up to 200+ ticks behind so I logged another ticket.  I was once again told to send the server info via Spark commands, which I did.  I was then told it was the wrong information and to download Spark.  When I said I'd already downloaded Spark and had run the commands through /sparkc (/spark didn't register as a command), I was given a link to download Spark.  A few more "you need to download Spark and run the /spark command" messages later, and I just gave up and moved to a host that offered 12Gig for $30/month where my server has zero lag and zero crashing issues with more mods than we were using with Bisect as our host.

Purchased a "Premium Server" for Minecraft. It had a supposed 8GB RAM and was only played by a Max of five people at any given time. Within two days of playing, it crashed, resetting our world, and we lost all our progress. I tried the "auto restore" point to get back all of our data (The only data that should have been there); Lost. The next day on our new world it crashed twice and was accelerating in intervals of how frequent it crashed. I contacted support to see what was going on with the server. Was told it was a "chunk tick" issue, that it was processing too much data and was causing it to crash repeatedly. I was then informed that the support agent was going to max the limit to see if it stopped the crashing; it did not. After the third crash I contacted support again. This time they wanted to try to restore my initial world that was "saved" when I started the game. Still no luck and more crashing. I decided to give up and cancel my subscription to look elsewhere.

Review.Titre: There were a few issues in renting the…

Bad servers. Barely ran.

We started up a modded minecraft server for up to 10 players with 7GB of ram. We started noticing poor performance and opted to upgrade to 12GB but have seen worse performance. Multicraft page showed we were using upwards to 80% of ram and less than 10% CPU before upgrade and around 40% of ram after upgrade. Support has explained this is due to a Minecraft update but failed to explain why an upgrade has not resulted in any improvements. Feels like we're being throttled down to our original 7GB package.

Review.Titre: Tried to get a server with RLCRAFT…
Review.Contenu: Tried to get a server with RLCRAFT going, recommended is 4GB RAM from your site and the modpack creator. I got 6GB plan to be safe, game is not playable. Server falls behind hundreds if not thousands of milliseconds. No matter what I do. Even when I am alone on the server it constantly tells me the server is overloaded. Which I do not get quite frankly. With 6-8GB ram I can host a 10-20 player LAN session on my laptop without any lags ever.There is no fix to be found on the internet. If you could fix this issue for me then I will definitely change my rating. It would be otherwise 5 stars. A bit more expensive but very clean UI and friendly people etc. But the game that I wanted to play does not work.

Review.Titre: The service is ok but the servers are…
Review.Contenu: The service is ok but the servers are not very powerful, I have tried a mod pack with 170 mods, 10GB of ram and it is lag with 4 players without having explored more than 3 thousand blocks.

Haveing alot of trouble with the stability of the server, and there is only three of us. i have no way to alter map settings, to play the modpack the way we want. i cant change the seed for a better one, i have to change the name and HOPE a good name has a good seed.

I recently rented one of your servers for me and some friends. Several times so far the server has closed, crashed or had problems with its connectivity to us. I expected better as this provider was recommended by the modpack we are using and the price I am paying for this premium server.

Came down to poor server performance. For the package I was on, I expected a higher quality server. MSPT would sky rocket when a second player/bot joined the server. Was also unable to run a smaller world eater without the server crashing. There also wasn't any information about the server specifications outside of allocated ram.

Server modding failures.I asked about 3 times on how modding this server works and I get the same cut and paste reply every time.I know how to read.I read the instructions and it is still not clear. I told your representative at the time and got the same copy paste reply.Clearly don't care. Otherwise would have actually listened to my question instead of assuming everyone is as familiar or tech-savvy as they are.

Review.Titre: There seems to be a problem. (Valheim)
Review.Contenu: There seems to be a problem with the server for Valheim(modded).Here's what I and my friends encountered.1. Monsters or bosses somehow became invisible to most of the players. (All of my friends have considerably high-end PCs, so it's not because of us.)2. We can't pick up the items dropped on the ground. (need to wait for about 2-3 minutes)3. Grave can't be seen or interacted with. (again, we have to wait for 2-3 minutes)P.S. There are none of these problems when we host the server ourselves.P.S.2 Anything besides this is FINE.

Server is currently offline. Was hoping for assistance, got generic fix. Server is unavailable as far as I can tell. Still paying for server. Will probably cancel as of next week. Hopefully this isn't a public review board because the server setup was easy and simple and when it worked it worked well. Minimal lag. Otherwise I hope that you all can provide better service in the future. Thanks!

Unable to connect.Unfortunately for the Valheim servers the port requires to be based on the manual, otherwise there will be issues in terms of seeing the servers in the server list and also my friends couldn't connect if it wasn't the standard port.Unfortunately due to this I couldn't use bisect hosting for the Valheim hosting and instead set up our own server and unblocked the relevant ports and we could all connect.

I already talked to the staff about this, but it charges me more than what I had to pay. The email they sent me said that I could cancel the order, but the tutorial for the cancelation didn't work for me. I'm not saying the whole website is bad because the staff try and make sure I have the best experience with what I purchased, but I'm a little disappointed with what I received from the purchase.

Review.Titre: I got a server that had 5gb of RAM for…
Review.Contenu: I got a server that had 5gb of RAM for up to 5 players. However even when online alone there was extreme server lag when just cutting trees when the leaves despawned/broke. I couldn't imagine how laggy or worse it would become once we started introducing machines and automation that would draw more RAM. Dont recommend unless maybe you pay for even more RAM to play.

Asked for a refund when my server was constantly crashing and restarting on the first day of playing it, now two weeks later they're telling me the refund is out of the time window for one when I never received it. Their customer service has been great at attempting to trouble shoot the issue, though a friend of mine had purchased another server through a different company that we have been using relatively crash and lag free with the same options since I initially rented a server through bisect hosting. I just wanted a refund was all.

The server I bought is lacking even though I'm paying for 8 gbs of ram the server is constantly behind on memory and skipping ticks so it has to be reset every now and then and that still doesn't fix it I keep going up in ram and nothing fixes it there is only two people at most on it and even when its running by itself it still is behind on ticks until it restarts automatically but it doesn't catch up.
This will be a short review. I liked the installation of the Modpack. It was easy and quick however the Server seems to crash quiet often even though I have above the recommended amount of Memory.

Review.Titre: We’re having issues all the time with…lag
Review.Contenu: We’re having issues all the time with server lag even running a more basic mod pack. The dedicated cpu cores seem to still struggle on just generating chunks or loading player data. All around still a much worse experience then self hosting for performance

Review.Titre: We ran into a issue where my friends…
Review.Contenu: We ran into a issue where my friends and I couldn't connect but was due to our error. Now a week later we've been having issues trying to login. The server lags more even though it's based in LA and we're in Nevada. The server doesn't want to stop after 5 minutes so if I want to shut off the server to update or just so we can login I have to kill the server. Running our own server seemed to have less issues. These are issues that i shouldn't even be running into for $30 a month I believe.

Hosting a nodded server with less than 10 friends. Server has difficult time keeping up with just one of us online, crashes occasionally when multiple of us are on. Server panel is nice, but I wouldn't recommend listening to the recommended ram it tells you.

Review.Titre: I asked for help with a specific…
Review.Contenu: I asked for help with a specific situation and all I got was an email saying you were aware of the issue and working on it. There was no “communication” with a support staff member. I checked the server to see if it was fixed to find out that it was. No one told me. No one even acknowledged the issue I was having. Just, “ we’re aware” like an automated response. Nothing  else. The server host I left for this one, though they could not resolve the issue they were having, at least had great customer service so I am a bit let down by Bisect. Now I am having trouble with the server constantly kicking players off and not sure I want to ask for help if the response will be so generic and  insincere.

Review.Titre: Low power, rough interface = unhappy customer.
Review.Contenu: The prices aren't terrible and I got a good deal to get started.My issues did not become apparent until after the refund policy ended unfortunately.  The power of the servers leaves much to be desired.  Lag has been pretty common, the server interface is not to my liking.  I have no idea how much memory is being used, or what's taxing the server behind the scenes other then what the console tells me.  Use the plugins, if you don't have much experience with plugins you're out of luck, because again, the interface is not intuitive.  This coming from a server admin who worked on the game and store side verses the plugins.  I won't be returning when my time runs out for the month.

Hello my name is Modded Bisect Server I've come to Lags anonymous, I would like to thank Internet explorer for inviting me today. I have a small  set of mods about 60-70 yet doing anything can take anywhere up to 5 minutes, plus my users get kicked because my tps is so bad.

The entire platform seems very over-engineered... I had a very hard time figuring out how to begin the hosting of my minecraft server even after I purchased the membership and I'm a software engineer.

Review.Titre: I do not recommend this hosting

My experience with the server was a multitude of crashes caused by players just playing the game as intended. As well as constant freezing even when all players have great connection, it was global lag not individual. Overall not the best experience.

Review.Titre: My server is shutting down and experiencing lag.
Review.Contenu: I have had a great amount of fun with the server I am paying for, and I thank you for hosting it. Although this is true, my server often has a lot of lag, and without me doing anything, shuts down. This has been very annoying, and is not at all what I thought I was getting into. Unless this problem of server shut downs and lag can be fixed, I am going to have to go with another company to host my friends' and my world.

Review.Titre: Most services have a way to see your…
Review.Contenu: Most services have a way to see your ram and cpu usage that bisect lacks. I was also pretty put off by having been referred to the service and not got my first month discount or had my referer receive their benefits because I went for a multi-month plan. The nickle and diming for extra features wouldn't bother me so much if it wasn't obvious that the site is intentionally clunky to promote the sale of those features. I'm half way through my 3 months and I'll be comparing other hosting in the next few weeks

Review.Titre: Won’t fix the issue, wants me to point to their nameservers
Review.Contenu: I asked them in a support ticket to add the resolver ip addressees for cloudflare so I can add an addon domain in cPanel, their solution was to temporarily point the domain to their nameservers which I already have dns configured with cloudflare and doing that would break everything that relies on the dns records being there for the domain. I will be moving my site to BuyShared once the hosting package expires as they are more willing to help over there.

Review.Titre: I haven’t been able to host a server it…
Review.Contenu: I haven’t been able to host a server it doesn’t let me.

I have had massive issues connecting to my server and spent days talking to support with absolutely no solution or cause being found. When I asked for a refund on account of not being able to join my own server for multiple days, I was denied. Support is typically very fast however, and they did try many solutions. The only exception was the one occasion where I had to wait 40 minutes between responses on my first ticket. I honestly believe the support is better than the service. Even now I still can’t join my own server.My advice is: if in the first three days you encounter an “Internal Error” ask for a refund, as for whatever reason their servers hate your connection and the problem will never go away, you wont be able to connect to your server for hours and sometimes days on end.

There used to be unlimited modpack install and now it only a 3 day free trial.

Poor server hosting reliability. Even with a few people on the server and minimum use, server connection becomes too poor to use without many restarts. Several attempts were made to fix connection issues with support and were unsuccessful. Will not be renewing with them.

Review.Titre: About what you'd expect on the cheap.
Review.Contenu: Pricing is cheap, but you get what you pay for. Actually paying them is a serious chore too, since they refuse to acknowledge payments are made until just before the due date, leading people to believe they need to give more money than they do.

Very expensive for small freind group modded servers. Having to pay extra for quick modpack updates just punishes the active player base who are playing the newer packs, which seem like not the base you want to alienate

Me and my friend are constantly getting lag spikes and booted from the game despite having good internet speeds when tested. Don't know how to fix this problem as others who use the same wifi don't have this issue.

Review.Titre: Worked good. Better options to find.
Review.Contenu: Overall the server worked well. I went for a 5gigs ram server. But the website sends lots of emails and it's annoyingly pushy. I also quickly found a better solution with an old laptop used as a server box..

Review.Titre: Frequent outages and bad rubber banding
Review.Contenu: Frequent rubberbanding and outages made it extremely difficult to hold a server through BisectHosting. It was really frustrating because I was trying to stream with my viewers and I was constantly having issues.
TYPE ISSUEIt was going good then it would not let me tap or type it made my time bad becouse i never played online minecraft im mad
The server was laggy and me and my friends almost cant play on it and moat of the times the server doesnt even open
Hi i have a problem, write to a support and then we were chating and then he closed chat and my problem is still unsolved.

Like the customer support, me and my friends have used you guys several times. Only big complaints I have is everything we host our original server location is always super super laggy and we have to change it to have the sever run decently and if we need support at like 3 am they usually can't fix it and whoever takes over for them in the morning fixes it in like 3 seconds

The UI is user friendly, it is but you'll need to watch hours of video for any custom Minecraft mod packs. The servers in New Jersey were down for myself not long after I got a pack running so I couldn't use the free trial stuff so that went to waste, I ended up paying for it since their videos for it were either outdated or misleading. But after I paid the extra 3 dollars (I think it was) it was easier. I haven't had any other issues other than instances not being able to delete and start over

Review.Titre: Lag despite below recommended player size.
Review.Contenu: So I bought a 6 gigabyte server to run a custom forge modpack on. That being said the gui and console is very user friendly, and I applaud. The only issues I face right now is the lag I got with my price. Consistently I average three to four players on at a time, but it crashes frequently when there is more than three. I’d like to upgrade but the price for one gigabyte more is a whole extra two dollars. Now the lag is tolerable most of the time, and it has highs and lows, but I can’t rate any higher because of it.

Review.Titre: I would like to be able to change…
Review.Contenu: I would like to be able to change modpacks whenever I want without having to pay a fee, even if I do it myself.

Review.Titre: Bisect is a very good server hosting…
Review.Contenu: Bisect is a very good server hosting website, however the thing that got this review to 3 stars was the help I got from costumer support. Managing the server itself was somewhat hard and UI was simply not clear enough to what it did. The main problem I had was just configuring the server but the server it self in-game was really good.

I really like the communication and how quickly problems are addressed. That being said I had an issue with extreme server lag and still do. I upgraded the server from 10GB to 14GB of ram still had issues on a 6GB recommended pack. Customer support did a check on it for corrupt chunks it didn't really change anything the server is still messing up I'll probably just end up canceling at the end of this month.

Review.Titre: The support is fast at responding.but…
Review.Contenu: The support is fast at responding.but that's about the main good thing.my server lags a ton and I will only assume that's because the modpack we chose. Maybe needs more ram would fix the issue. but the cost for the server hosting is quite expensive so I will not pay for more once my server time is done

It was INSANELY confusing to make my world into a server! I spent many hours trying to get it up and running. If that was the only problem it probably would have been a or four. But there are also frequent server crashes. If those two glaring flaws get fixed then it would probably be a 5. The reason I give 3 stars instead of 2 is because their customer service is on point.

Review.Titre: At the beginning of the server
Review.Contenu: At the beginning of the server, everything was working smoothly. My friends and I, were able to hold 40 mods that equated to .12G and things worked fantastic for just 8gb for a server. However, we are able to get the same result on pebblehosting for only 8$ a month, with reasonable server statistics. I think the prices, in my opinion, are a bit expensive. On the third day of the world, we started to receive lag spikes, which disappointed my experience with the server itself.

Review.Titre: I would rate bisecthosting a 5 star but you need to buy package 2 for ark
Review.Contenu: I would rate bisecthosting a 5 star but I have a really big complaint to make. The fact that you can't run an ark server with package one. You have to buy package two to be able to have more than 3 players and some crusial mods. Although it is still kind of cheap, I would still want to spend that money on for example an ark cluster.

Review.Titre: A lot of lag with more than recommended ram
Review.Contenu: Modding is very easy, but my server has been lagging and restarting for my friends and I all day. It's just vanilla minecraft with plug-ins and I have a 6GB plan. The plugings I am using through your modding page recommends 4gb so I thought I would be way covered with 6. The "mod" is just a bunch of plug-ins, not even mods

There seems to be some kind of ai suppression that we experience only on your services, particularly with villagers and trying to trade with them, their ai breaks and then they don’t restock. This is of course most affected by villagers which directly interact with players

Review.Titre: Good client service, improvement is possible in servers
Review.Contenu: The support tickets system is really good, they answer at any hour and really fast too. The servers are fine, they do feel a bit laggy and I wish there were more options to manage the server.

I've had a server for a few weeks now and it seems to be down at least once or more per week. When it works, it works very well, but it gets very frustrating having to wait until the "node" I'm on is working again.

Most to Nealy every time using I lose connection with the host or something happens with the host that makes me lose some progress. I get a message on screen saying this. I go to the control panel and the server has reset or in the process of resetting. If this is normal then it's very annoying. Only takes 10 minutes to get back online but when there is a group of you playing then we get get the boot.

Review.Titre: server kicks all player's then becomes unavailable.
Review.Contenu: I ordered the cheapest ark survival evolved server BisectHosting offered and I would like to be satisfied with it as I've not suffered much if any lag or rubber banding, but randomly every 5 or 6 hours it will kick all players and then no longer be available in the search menu for the game ark. untill I do a server restart that is.

Review.Titre: You can’t switch from the budget to…
Review.Contenu: You can’t switch from the budget to premium easily. Server in NJ was down on my friend’ birthday and we couldn’t play for his birthday stream.

Review.Titre: Easy accessibility but multiple server issues.
Review.Contenu: I liked how easy it was to set up to the server and connect. The server owner interface was also very useful but I found that I had a lot of difficulties setting up a secondary server restart time. I was following guides and setting the correct scheduled restart times using the converter to UTC but the server still never restarted. On top of this my RLCraft server with my friends had 8GB of RAM but it was still constantly lagging whenever we explored with multiple consecutive 5-10 second server freezes in a row. We decided to spend the extra buck and upgrade to 12GB but it didn’t really fix the issue at all.

I got one of their budget plans (8 GB of ram). I installed a self built mod pack that I had already tested elsewhere. During the first 4 days the server was excellent with good speed in chunk generation.But, then it started to go wrong and the speed was not the same, for no apparent reason. And I have only been playing on the server myself. It's still a better and cheap service compared to others, but that loss of performance (even on new worlds) I don't understand and dislike.

Review.Titre: The most basic service is a lie and not…
Review.Contenu: The most basic service is a lie and not enough.My first purchase was the most basic server (5 USD) with 3GB RAM for a 7 days to die server, but it couldn't even handle 2 persons in different locations (Always disconnected us) because it was using 3.5 GB RAM...It was until I had to upgrade to the tier 2 (11 USD) with 6GB RAM to be able to use the server as it consumes between 3.7 to 4.5 GB with 8 people inside and in different places! Which is almost the same as 2 persons...It's a complete lie or at least you should be able to gather all this kind of information an offer a minimum service for specific games BEFORE we make a purchase :)Something like a purchase wizard would be good: 1) What game are you going to be using the server for?2) This tier works for 2-8 people in the server (11 USD) - And this info changes depending on the game and expected people to join3) etc.

Mostly laggy, with features that are provided for free on other hosting platforms (like mod support) locked behind paywalls.I'm running a Minecraft Vault Hunters server and the recommended server specs cause lag for ~3 players unless you're all standing in the same place 100% of the time.Other than that, the setup is fast, mod setup is easy (if you pay for it) but they do also provide manual setup. The dashboard provided is useful but there are no performance metrics at all. Due to this, when your server lags, you can't tell what the bottleneck actually is. (There is apparently a downloadable plugin for server stats as stated on their dashboard, but this didn't work when I downloaded it - again, this is a basic feature provided by other hosting services).If you aren't looking to load a lot of chunks at once then the server runs mostly fine. I wouldn't recommend for Vault Hunters as the mod does require chunk loading. I'd personally try another service next time.

Review.Titre: Nice Support and Admin Panel, Unreliable Service so Far
Review.Contenu: I’ve been with Bisect for less than a month and I’ve had a mixed experience.One one hand, support is responsive and the server usually runs smoothly.Two big issues have come up though:1. My backup manager broke and permanently locked up one out of two manual backup slots offered on my plan. We’re going on one week of this being an issue and it still isn’t fixed (the ticket is open in my Support panel). The reason for this is that the automatic 7day backup process offered on the Premium plans totally broke (according to their System Admin) on my node. So… I’m glad I’m not a Premium subscriber? Sounds like a false sense of security.2. With the release of 1.20, server slowed down immensely, even with just a few players on the 4GB plan. When I asked support about it, it was due to high traffic. Aren’t I paying for 4GB? Why does other server traffic affect mine? So they moved me to a different node to make it better. So I’m happy it’s fixed, but still a weird thing to have happen.Overall, I’m doing my research again to see if other hosts offer a similarly robust admin panel (one of the great things about Bisect) but with a more reliable infrastructure.

Review.Titre: Recommended but knowledge base needs an update
Review.Contenu: Overall easy to setup, no issues or lag spikes while playing on the server. The ability to mod and setup missions is easy and enjoyable. However, one thing I really struggled with and the knowledge base failed to mention this was the fact when you drag and drop files into the server files via the website panel, it makes a sub folder instead of copying and pasting the file itself. I had issues with my mod list not reading because the html file got placed in its own sub folder and the server couldn’t read it. I found this out when I used FTP that revealed that it was actually putting into a folder. Only way I could ensure my drag and drop was not being placed in a new sub folder was to use the FTP. Otherwise it would have been a 5 star rating.

I try to be brutally honest when reviewing any media, so if someone happens to be on the fence on whether or not this service is legit or worth it for their needs, allow me to clear the air: This service is great. Extremely intuitive, snappy UI with a well-organized layout. I got this service to host a GregTech: New Horizons server and it was very easy to get things going. Having a dedicated tab for manual backups is awesome. Upgrading the modpack version when there was a new update was a little finicky, as access to server files is handled through menus rather than an actual folder you can just browse and drag through; altered files need to be reuploaded which can take some time, but that's really the only gripe I have–and even then it's not a huge problem. Overall this is a great service and I will 100% be using it again the next time I want to host a modpack server.

I had requested a mod be removed our server, they were quick to respond and complete the request but did not back up the server (although i did not tell them to, it is highly assumed you do it by default). They warned me about visual glitches when removing the mod and it did happen so we requested to go back to our original before removal but it was 5 hours prior to the mod removal which caused a lot of lost progress, many repeated restarts to a certain point and most people to quit. As i said the staff are lovely, were very sorry and gave a discount on the next payment but yeah a easily avoidable mistake.

Review.Titre: Overall great hosting platform with one major drawback
Review.Contenu: Overall great hosting platform.  My major complaint is that I can't see server hardware usage stats by default.  I used Apex hosting in the past and would have again, except they didn't have the pack we wanted to play.  They have usage statistics enabled by default.  I did notice a plugin to view resource usage on your site but after installing the plugin my server continually crashed on startup and I had to restore it to an old backup.  We didn't lose any progress but I found the entire experience frustrating and wish usage stats were automatically tracked, not locked behind selectively functional plugins.Overall I am happy with my experience using Bisect, It is comparable to Apex in every way except the usage stat readouts.  However, since all else is equal this one issue does mean I would go back to Apex given the option.  I remain here because you have a wider offering of mod packs.  If/when we move to another pack that Apex does offer I would return unless the stats are added/fixed.

I've been using different server services a while. I've had Minecraft since it was in Alpha 1.7.3 and still occasionally come back to it. I've run my own server out of an old machine I threw linux on, and had a lot more success there than with previous subscription servers so I stopped using them for a while. Me and my friends wanted to do a modded run this time, and after failing to build our own little vanilla+ pack for it, we quickly switched to BMC4, adding a couple mods. We found that BMC4, much like many other premade packs, simply doesn't work immediately when you drop it on a forge server. There's something the authors forgot, perhaps, or the version is out of date, or whatever the case, we quickly ran into headache, and this being short notice, I didn't have the time or medicine to suppress the inevitable migraine, so we went and purchased a server off BisectHosting. We weighed our options of servers and our pings and picked a budget server that fit what we needed better than available Permium servers.So far so good. The service gives full access to the files of the server without needing and FTP app open and connecting. You can simply drag and drop like most modern websites (I wanna guess React was used but I've not looked at any of the web code and likely won't bother to) and quickly situates the files correctly. Every mod pack you could want to run is preset and working, the service loads it all up and runs the server instantly, letting you get right to playing without any hassle. Whole packs and individual mods both are super easy to change and reinstall with different versions, right inside the gui of the website.It's a bit on the expensive side, even with a discount code on the first month, but the service is 100% worth it. I haven't had a single issue server side that wasn't user error. That's incredible, I remember a number of other services having server lag at weird intervals, and I can safely say I haven't seen anything of the sort running with 4 people on at once. We anticipated more and so have paid a little more for the extra power/space, but it likely isn't the only reason this service runs so smooth.The layout is a little wonky, but once I figured out everything was all set and I could manage the server with ease all while playing on it as well. 10/10 would recommend, they're hands down the best option for Minecraft gamers if any type.
